title.@value: Fetus or newborn affected by maternal infectious diseases

definition.@value: A condition affecting fetuses or newborns, that is (or suspected to be) caused by a maternal infection with a bacterial, viral, fungal, or parasitic source.

label.@value: Infections of the genital tract in pregnancy
Fetus or newborn affected by maternal infectious diseases
Gonorrhoea complicating pregnancy, childbirth or puerperium, affecting fetus or newborn
Maternal rubella affecting fetus or newborn
Syphilis complicating pregnancy, childbirth or puerperium, affecting fetus or newborn
Tuberculosis complicating pregnancy, childbirth or puerperium, affecting fetus or newborn
